title: Assistant Showroom Manager
description:
**We LOVE that you are interested in learning more about this role and what makes Lovesac unique!**  

**WHO we are?** Here at Lovesac, our Lovesac Family is comprised of a diverse team who exemplify the following values:

* Core Values: Top Ambition, Willing to sweep floors, Grit
* Aspirational Values: Customer Centricity, Only A Players, Executional Excellence, Consciousness
* Table-Stakes Values: Positive, Passionate, Collaborative, Flexible, Self-starting, Self-aware, Candid, Empathetic, Inclusive, Insatiable Learners

We are committed to working and succeeding by incorporating our Guiding Principles into every aspect of our business:


We can all win together  

We do as we say  

Do less and do best  

Were borrowing this earth from our children  

Love matters

**We Offer Our Full Time Associates:**

* Paid Time Off & Holiday Pay
* Sales Incentive Programs
* 401K Matching Contribution
* Paid Parental Leave
* Medical, Dental, Vision Benefit Plans
* Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts
* Life/AD&D, Short Term and Long-Term Disability
* Critical Illness and Accident Insurance
* Employee Assistance Program
* Financial Wellness Tools
* Associate Discounts
* Pet Insurance


Associates will be eligible to receive up to 125 hours of paid time off within our fiscal calendar year. They will be paid 1 1/2 times their regular rate for any hours worked over 40 hours in a work week. In addition, they will be eligible to receive 8 paid company recognized holidays and will be paid 1 1/2 times their regular rate for any hours worked on these holidays. Eligibility and terms for all benefits listed are as outlined in Lovesacs policy and plan documents.

**Our Purpose:**


At Lovesac, we are committed to bringing Total Comfort to millions of homes. That means having furniture that can evolve along with them as life unfolds.


From Sactionals The World's Most Adaptable Couch, to Sacs The World's Most Comfortable Seat, Lovesac products provide peace of mind where others cannot. Our products can adapt to fit almost any space and style and look like new forever. This enables a new way of living, where people can continue to invest in, add to, and evolve their furniture instead of adding it to the landfill which is good for families and our environment.

**What We Believe:**


Love. It is the name we live up to. We champion building meaningful relationships as we foster a culture that embraces and celebrates the experiences, beliefs, backgrounds, expertise, talent, and individuality of everyone. We purposefully and meaningfully weave DEI into every aspect of our business. We seek to promote love, inclusion, and happiness in all that we do. #LoveMatters

**The Role:**


Currently, we are seeking to hire an Assistant Showroom Manager. As an Assistant Store Manager, you are responsible to deliver sales results for the store. You have a passion for our product and our customers, creating a unique experience for them. An Assistant Store Manager, in partnership with the Store Manager, assists with training Sales Associates, Operations, Merchandising, Inventory, expense control, and shrink.


Summary of Key Job Responsibilities:


* Responsible to meet or exceed all goals and key performance indicators (KPIs).
* Assist with consistent store operations to meet or exceed sales goals.
* Assist in training store team to meet or exceed financial goals through the execution of Lovesacs proprietary selling process to deliver sales results consistently.
* Resolve issues for the customers satisfaction working in a collaborative partnership with Store Manager and follows up with the customer on order tracking and updates.
* Ensure and maintain inventory integrity and accuracy protecting company assets at all times.
* Direct the execution of promotional campaigns including product placement and marketing.
* Ensure store merchandising standards are maintained (i.e., merchandising visuals, marketing, cleanliness, appropriate inventory levels, backroom organization, cleanliness, safety, etc.) in accordance with Company operating policies and procedures.
* Process POS transactions (i.e., sales, returns and exchanges) in accordance with company policies and provides accurate information to clients.
* Maintain a calm demeanor and manage issues professionally and respectfully in accordance with our company standards.
* Act with integrity and trust, modeling behavior that respects our employees, peers and customers in accordance with the core values of our company.
* Perform any other duties as requested by management.


Requirements & Qualifications:

* Must have a minimum of 1-2 years of related sales and management experience.
* Engages product knowledge to drive and achieve sales results independently and with the store team.
* Able to build rapport with both customers and the store team and act always with the customer in mind.
* Must be results driven and utilize knowledge to meet or exceed KPIs and goals.
* Must have proven time management skills and quickly adapts to a changing business environment.
* Able to prioritize responsibilities with the appropriate level of urgency, able to listen and can use this information to solve problems, anticipate issues and make correct decisions based on a variety of situations.
* Must take accountability and responsibility for your actions.
* Must have the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously while meeting deadlines consistently.
* Must have superior communication skills; verbal, written and interpersonal skills; able to listen effectively to solve problems, anticipate issues and make effective decisions.
* Demonstrates strong analytical, mathematical and problem-solving skills.
* Maintains the highest level of customer service, creating solutions and experiences that drive business results and engagement with the brand.
* Must work collaboratively with fellow employees, treating all clients, both internal and external with dignity and respect at all times.
* Proficiency required in Microsoft Office: Word, Excel & PowerPoint.
* Must comply with the standards, policies and procedures outlined in the Lovesac Employee Handbook.
* Must be capable of using and operating all equipment as required, including but not limited to: iPad, laptop, etc. Be able to move objects (including medium to large furniture items up to 75 pounds) from a lower to a higher position or horizontally from position-to-position or be able to assemble furniture while working on the selling floor or in our warehouse.
* Must be able to travel, as required by the Company in its sole discretion, for occasional meetings and conferences using various forms of transportation.
* Consistent ability to work both offsite and report into designated Touchpoint, or Corporate Headquarters as required and in accordance with Lovesac policies, CDC and State Guidelines.
* Support Lovesac Vendors as needed with local offsite events.


Our retail touchpoints, including our website, are open seven days a week and require morning, evening, weekend and holiday availability.


Associate pay will vary based on factors such as qualifications, experience, skill level and competencies.


Lovesac is an Equal Opportunity employer and considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religious creed, ancestry, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, marital status, disability, military status, genetic information or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

title: Russian Speaking Family Nurse Practitioner
description:
Job Overview:  
We are seeking a dedicated and experienced Family Nurse Practitioner to join our healthcare team. The ideal candidate will provide primary care services to patients of all ages, focusing on health promotion, disease prevention, and managing chronic conditions.

Responsibilities:  
- Conduct comprehensive physical assessments  
- Diagnose and treat common acute illnesses and injuries  
- Manage chronic health conditions such as diabetes, hypertension, and asthma  
- Prescribe medications and treatments  
- Educate patients on disease prevention and healthy lifestyle choices  
- Collaborate with physicians and other healthcare professionals to ensure holistic patient care  
- Maintain accurate medical documentation

- Master's or Doctorate degree in Nursing  
- Current Family Nurse Practitioner certification  
- State licensure as a Nurse Practitioner  
- Minimum of 2 years of experience in a primary care setting  
- Proficiency in sterile processing techniques  
- Basic life support (BLS) certification  
- Experience in utilization review and emergency medicine preferred  
- Knowledge of laboratory procedures and interpretation of results  
- Competency in pediatric care, including tube feeding and dermal fillers

Joining our team offers competitive compensation, benefits packages, and opportunities for professional growth. If you meet these requirements and are passionate about delivering high-quality patient care, we encourage you to apply for this rewarding position as a Family Nurse Practitioner.

title: Guidance Counselor/ Intake Coordinator
description:
The Madonna Heights School is a fully accredited New York State Regents Junior/Senior High School for adolescent girls who are struggling in their community school or live on the Madonna Heights campus at our Group Residence or Residential Treatment Facility. Small class sizes provide an active learning environment. Students have the opportunity to participate fully while receiving individual attention as they learn, explore and develop leadership potential. Day students are referred by their local school district.

**I.** **SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES:** 

· Intake of academic information and placement of new students in proper classes when they arrive to the school building.

· Retrieving academic transcripts of new students, usually contacting two to three schools as well as obtaining records during periods of hospitalizations.

· Initial scheduling and scheduling changes including students who have difficulty with class work, placement changes due to the received transcripts, and students who have problems with other students in the class.

· Reviewing academic transcripts to make sure students are placed properly in the right classes and are on track for graduation.

· Meeting with students to review progress reports and report cards to discuss failures and how to improve grades for next marking period.

· Reviewing and maintaining IEP’s so students are placed properly in class and that class number size is not out of configuration.

· Support overall testing needs of school; registering students for exams; Regents, SAT, ACT, NYS Common Core Tests (7 & 8th grades) and maintaining records of scores. Also coordinating testing with school districts; request proctors when necessary, picking up and dropping off tests, determining grading for tests (if school district grades or MHS grades), ensuring that MHS maintains accurate records of all tests that are sent back to districts.

· Meeting with students to complete Transition Data Collection Forms.

· Developing and executing transition plan for student discharge.

· Observing students and writing Behavior Intervention Plans in collaboration with Behavior Specialist, CSE Chair and clinical team.

· Meeting with students who are having problems with class work, teachers and other students, etc.

· Review intake referral packets

· Schedule screening with students, parent/guardian

· Admission of Day School students

· And all other tasks as assigned by Principal.

**II.** **QUALIFICATIONS:**

· **College Degree, NYS Certification**

· Acceptable clearance checks for State Central Register, Driver license and fingerprinting as required by the program.

· Compliance with health regulations for physical/ mantoux testing.

· Attending TCI class for certification/re-certification and passing a test upon completion of course is a minimum requirement for employment.

title: UAS RN - Home Care
company: Premier Home Health Care Services, Inc.
description:
Premier Home Health Care Services, Inc. is a leading established Home Health Care Agency currently seeking UAS-NY certified Registered Nurses to perform UAS Assessments in Manhattan and Bronx.

**Responsibilities of the UAS RN:**

* Assess eligibility of Medicaid members in need of managed long-term care using the UAS-NY web-based system.
* Conduct initial assessments and re-assessments **in member’s homes or at skilled nursing facilities,** according to state guidelines, policies and protocols.
* Consult with health care providers and review medical records and medications to support assessment outcomes.
* Provides education to members, caregivers regarding health issues, preventive care, medication management and plan benefits.
* Review and revise assessments as necessary based on company policy.
* Conducts quality checks on all completed documents before finalizing and sending.
* Abide by and promote Agency administrative policies.
* Attend meetings and training as required (webcam or in-person).
* Maintain current and active Health Commerce System (HCS) access.
* Maintain a continuing knowledge of competencies related to the nursing profession by participating in formal education programs, conferences, workshops, and professional organizations.

**Qualifications**

* RN, BSN Preferred. Current, valid, and unencumbered RN license, certificate, or registration or credentialing as required.
* New York State Registered Nursing (RN) license in good standing.
* **UAS-NY Certification**
* Proven knowledge of UAS-NY Assessments and proficiency in use of UAS-NY.
* Experience as a NY licensed RN working in a home care environment or in an acute, sub-acute, or long term care (LTC) setting or managed long term care (MLTCP).

**Skills Required**

* Solid assessment and documentation skills.
* Ability to effectively communicate verbally and in written formats at all levels.

title: Youth Counselor
description:
Are you reliable, hardworking and looking to work for the best? If so, come join YWCA Northern New Jersey , the #1 school age program in Bergen County. We are currently hiring for the New School Year 2024- 2025 in the following locations: Oradell, Cresskill, Dumont, Harrington Park.

The Youth Counselor works to assist the Site Supervisor to operate the assigned Before and After School Program to the standards set by the YWCA NNJ and State of New Jersey Department of Children and Families. title: LPN - The Residence at Westport
description:
**If you have been looking for a careerthat loves you back... This is the one!**

**LCB Senior Living is hiringLPNs at The Residence at Westport. Apply today for immediate consideration**


\\*\\*$33-$36/Hour (based on experience)\\*\\*

**What We Offer:**

* **Great benefits starting from Day One (Full-Time)**
	+ Health
	+ Vision
	+ Dental
	+ 401k
* Paid Time Off (Full time and Part Time)
* Work with an Amazing Team!
* Possibility for tuition reimbursement
* Rewarding role working with seniors


SUMMARY:


Active member of the Resident Care Team and assists the Resident Care Director with the management of the community. The management scope includes direct supervision of Resident Care Associates as well as monitoring emerging health needs of residents, covering for resident care staffing as needed and assisting the Resident Care Director with on-call duties. The Wellness Nurse will follow up on family issues as directed by Resident Care Director.


ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:


The essential duties and responsibilities described below are representative of those an associate encounters while performing the basic functions of this position. While every effort has been made to identify the essential functions of the position, it in no way states or implies that these are the only duties you will be required to perform. The omission of specific statements of duties does not exclude them from the position if the work is similar, related or is an essential function of the position.


1. Promote the mission and core values of the Residence and LCB Senior Living to residents, visitors, co-workers and the surrounding community.


2. You are expected to have an active role in growing community occupancy by representing and interacting positively with potential residents, family members and professionals.


3. Assist with the evaluation of resident needs and the development and revision of service plans as per state regulatory requirements.


4. Demonstrate an understanding of patho-physioligical and psychosocial changes that is associated with the aging process and disabilities.


5. Directs and supervises the daily work assignments of resident care associates.


6. Evaluates residents issues and medical concerns and discusses with the ED, family and MD as appropriate.


7. Encourage teamwork through cooperative interactions with all departments to assist in eliminating / correcting problem areas and overall improvement of services.


8. Monitors resident care assistants compliance with infection control/sharps disposal program.


9. Participates in community marketing effort.


10. Participates in the direct care of residents on an as needed basis.


11. Provides support to resident care associates regarding assignment questions or concerns as well as emergency situations.


12. Ensuring that all required staffing and schedules (if applicable), including backup coverage for staff is met at all times.


13. Ensure completion and review of incident / accident reports and implement changes through proper channels (i.e. Safety Committee etc.) to minimize future issues. Ensure proper communication with LCB Senior Living and state compliance reporting.


14. Assists the Resident Care Director with all documentation required by LCB Senior Living or the State Requirements.


15. With written physicians orders, administers topical and oral medications as well as ear and eye drops (LMA in Massachusetts), administers injectables where allowed by regulation.


16. Other duties as requested.


PHYSICAL AND ENVIRONMENTAL DEMANDS:


Good physical and mental health. Finger and hand dexterity to handle and manipulate instruments and equipment. Visual and auditory acuity. Must be able to lift a minimum of fifteen (15) lbs., and be able to carry objects. Must be able to push and pull carts, and continuously walk, sit and stand. Must be able to turn, crouch, kneel, stoop, bend below waist, and reach above shoulder height as tasks dictate. Must use good body mechanics. Should be neat and well groomed. Must project a positive attitude towards the service provided.


QUALIFICATION STANDARDS: (These qualifications meet or exceed VT, NH, MA, CT and RI State specific requirements.)


a. *Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:* The professional knowledge and skills necessary to assist in the planning for the Resident Care Department in accordance with the current state, federal and local standards to insure that the highest degree of quality care is maintained at all times. The ability to communicate effectively in English both orally and in writing is essential. May require lifting, bending and standing for extended periods of time.


b. *Education:* A high school diploma and graduation from an accredited Nursing Program.


c. *Experience:* At least two years of experience in a geriatric setting and previous health experience in hospital and/or community setting.


d. *Certificates/Licenses:* Current RN or LPN License in the state you are employed.

title: MANAGER, SANITATION
description:
Do you love candy and snacks? Are you looking to join an ever evolving and rapidly growing team? PIM Brands might just be exactly what youre looking for!


At PIM, we make the brands you love. Our portfolio of products, from Welchs Fruit Snacks to Sun-Maid Chocolate Raisins and Sour Jacks Sour Candies are enjoyed by millions of consumers every day. And when it comes to careers, we seek talented, results-oriented individuals who want to play a part in building amazing brands and products while working in a collaborative, dynamic, and fast-paced office environment. At PIM, you can make an immediate and lasting contribution to help grow iconic snack and confectionery brands, no matter your area of expertise.


We are looking for a **Sanitation Manager**interested in starting a SWEET career as part of our Sanitationteamat PIMs Somerset Facilitiesin Somerset, NJ.

**JOB OVERVIEW**


This position provides direction and leadership to sanitation & custodial employees to plan and execute the Master Sanitation Plan. Position will drive the strategy, development, implementation, and sustainability of the sanitation program to meet the regulatory and food safety requirements. This position also supports plant profitability by leading sanitation efficiency, including the development of more efficient & effective cleaning methods, developing standard work, training, cleaning validation, identification & execution of annual operational savings.

**DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Create and maintain the Master Sanitation Schedule with reported feedback from Production Supervisors & Leads after sanitation is conducted.
* Responsible for monitoring, verifying, and validating sanitation and quality programs.
* Identify areas of plant in need of sanitation and coordinate action plan with help from Operations management.
* Oversee sanitation supply ordering, inventory, and usage to ensure all production and janitorial teams are following SDS requirements and PPE standards. Manages chemical re-ordering.
* Report audit findings & responsible for completion of corrective action for monthly sanitation audits.
* Enhance measurement and improvement of sanitation effectiveness/performance.
* Coordinate PPE inventory and compliance across departments ensuring all employees are consistently utilizing required PPE for sanitation tasks.
* Provide expertise and leadership in Sanitation programs and SSOP to all employees & leadership partners.
* Carry out all QC/QA directives as they pertain to plant cleaning and sanitation.
* Follow PIM Brands GMP rules.
* Ensures the sanitizing and cleanliness of the facility and all production & packaging equipments.
* Establish and execute cleaning and sanitation procedures according to Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP's), OSHA, SQF
* Maintain safe work environment.
* Develop and implement new methods and process improvements to enhance safety performance and control costs.
* Interface with external vendors and contractors and monitor projects related to facility sanitation and chemical safety.
* Participate in production meetings and provide status reports of sanitation.
* Write and maintain detailed cleaning procedures and SSOP's in conjunction with QA/QC
* Ensures that an effective pest control program is in place and maximum results are achieved. Report and investigate either directly or by assisting, as necessary, any observation indicating compromise in control of mold, pest control and/or safety issues.
* Maintain a clean and sanitized environment according to specifications and standards.
* Hire, train and manage the budgeted staffing for the Sanitation department.
* Create and maintain a master cleaning schedule and program to ensure sanitation and cleanliness of the facility and all production equipment including writing and maintaining a detailed cleaning procedure and SSOP's according to Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP's) Part 110, etc. OSHA, SQF
* Manage/liaison for third party contract services for sanitation chemicals and pest control relationships.
* Manage sanitation and pest control programs, systems, procedures, & databases for the facility.
* Utilize technical skills and experience to trouble shoot sanitation, and pest control issues.
* Arrange GMP training for sanitation, safety, and appropriate persons.
* Coordinate and prepare plant for 3rd party GMP safety audits. Provides input and initiates investigations, when applicable, for all areas of Sanitation.
* Ensure proper training for employees in all departments on safe use of chemicals as appropriate.
* Manage and coordinate the pH room - ensure full compliance with wastewater system.
* Manage and coordinate the tray washing operation.
* Other duties as assigned by upper management.
* Oversee special projects, identify outside vendors, secure bids, recommend vendors and monitor their performance.
* Ability to work additional hours as needed.

**PHYSICAL DEMANDS/ ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS**


Standing, walking, sitting, bending, reaching, kneeling and crouching. Manual dexterity of hands and fingers to handle or feel objects, tools and controls. Lifting and moving of objects weighing at least 75 lbs. Reasonable accommodations will be evaluated and considered to enable an individual to perform the essential job functions.

**WORK ENVIRONMENT**


The job will generally be performed in the manufacturing plant. When on the plant floor it is representative of a large, busy manufacturing operation. Noisy, active, objects on the floor, constant movement, and traffic flow of motorized equipment. Hair net, beard net, assigned work uniform, protective eye wear and gloves are among the GMP required apparel that must be worn, if indicated, on the plant floor.


**EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE AND TRAINING**

* A four-year college degree in food science or science related field is required.
* Minimum 5-7 years experience in direct supervision in a food /pharmaceutical manufacturing environment
* Working knowledge of SQF, SDS, NSF, HACCP and GMP's
* Certified Sanitarian desired.
* SAP Experience desired.
* Possess a thorough knowledge and understanding of cleaning and sanitation procedures and supplies.
* Prior experience with wastewater systems and minimizing BODs.
* Strong and effective interpersonal, communications and team building skills essential.
* Good problem solving and analytical skills needed.
* Willing to be trained.
* Ability to read, speak, and write English required.


PIM Brands is an Equal Opportunity Employer. PIM Brands is an E-verify Employer.

**We are proud to offer:**

* Total compensation package including bonus, 401(k) plan match and other incentives (\\*based on eligibility and position)
* Comprehensive benefits package - EFFECTIVE DAY 1, Including medical, dental, vision, disability, insurance plans and much more
* Diverse range of benefit choices tailored to support you in making optimal decisions for yourself, your loved ones, and your preferred way of life
* Personal time off, vacation time, floating days and observed holidays
* Summer Fridays between Memorial Day weekend and Labor Day weekend
* Business casual dress
* Entrepreneurial and innovative culture offering the opportunity for internal career advancement

**Awards & Accolades:**

* #10 Candy Company in North America
* #26 Global Candy Company
* Makers of Welchs - #1 Fruit Snack in U.S.
* 2024 Advocate of the Year Award
* Recognized byNJBIA - State-of-the-Art Manufacturing Facility and in Research/Development 2024
* Recognized byNew Jersey Business Magazine2024
* Top 100 Privately Owned Company in the Metro NYC Market
* Top 50 Employer in New Jersey

If you are passionate about making a difference in the lives of students with special needs, we invite you to apply for this rewarding position. Join our team of dedicated professionals who are committed to providing quality education and support to every student.```

title: Animal Hospital Receptionist
description:
We are looking for a full-time **Receptionist** to join our team. As an essential business during uncertain times, our mission is to help our clients provide the best quality care for their pets. This requires the level of attention to detail and care to be expected from a top medical facility.

Our Receptionist handles all the calls and interactions with our clients. They are responsible for providing clients with product and service information, scheduling appointments, and checking patients in. This requires a detail-oriented person who is efficient at multitasking to review medical records for correctly timing visits and take clear messages.

This is a high-intensity environment that requires 100% accuracy. Think 911 call center.

We are looking for a professional who will love and care for our clients, and their fur families. While we care for pets, the receptionist is exclusively interacting with our staff with the goal of client satisfaction. This is an extremely rewarding job and very impactful to our community.

**Come be part of our team at the Animal Hospital of Morris Park!**

**RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Understand and communicate the value of our services to our clients
* Document client and patient records for excellent communication
* Answer continual stream of phone calls
* Manage tasks to support team workers and client satisfaction

* Someone who can work well under pressure in a fast-paced environment.
* A person who has great communication skills.

Currently, we are looking for candidates to fill in our **full-time position**. Part-time can be considered.

title: EHS Site Advisor
description:
Req ID:463851


Leading societies to a low carbon future, Alstom develops and markets mobility solutions that provide the sustainable foundations for the future of transportation. Our product portfolio ranges from high-speed trains, metros, monorail, and trams to integrated systems, customised services, infrastructure, signalling and digital mobility solutions. Joining us means joining a caring, responsible, and innovative company where more than 70,000 people lead the way to greener and smarter mobility, worldwide


**Purpose of the job:**


This position is mainly on construction site (80%) with an administrative portion (20%).


You will ensure compliance with EHS rules on the site for both Alstom employees and Alstom contractors for testing & commissioning phases on equipements and trains.This position will support EHS activities for both NYC and NJ Sites. You will work closely with the permit offices, the supervisors assigned to the contractors / employees, employees/contractors and the prime contractor.

  


Here are some examples of the responsibilities and tasks you will be assigned:

  


**Key accountabilities:**


* Inspections and monitoring on site
* Work permit overview
* *Support employees/contractors on risk assessment*
* Coaching of supervisors
* Broadcast EHS Induction for contractors / employees
* Contractors Management
* EHS Committee
* Broadcast monthly toolbox
* Accident investigation and action follow up
* Qualification of contractor EHS documentation and monitoring
* Emergency measures and first aid
* Has full authority and must stop any operational activity resulting in immediate high risk to People or the Environment.

  




**Performance measurements:**


* Documented inspections
* Total recordable Incident Rate
* Lost time / Fatality / severe accidents
* Modified work program
* Health and wellbeing activities
* Environmental (Energy, water, waste, TOPE, VOC,..)
* Training hours
* Contractor readyness
* Monthly Tool box
* Inspections / Audits

  




**Mandatory:**


* Bachelor's degree in EHS or related field is desired, but not required.
* Minimum experience of 2 years in Environment, Health & Safety
* Experience in construction or railway industry is required.
* Demonstrated leadership skills.
* *Good knowledge of Office (word, outlook etc), mandatory*
* Experience in projects, an asset
* Good written English, mandatory
* Driving license, mandatory
* Good knowledge and understanding of ISO14001, OHSAS 18001,ISO45001
* Deep knowledge of local legal requirements, OSHA.

  




**Competencies & Skills**


* Teamwork and leadership
* People skills
* Initiative and action driven
* Communication skills
* Analytic thinking, rigorous mindset
* Good computer skills
* Continuous Improvement tools

  




**Salary Range**


* $95,000-$110,000


Alstom is the leading company in the mobility sector, solving the most interesting challenges for tomorrow’s mobility. That’s why we value inquisitive and innovative people who are passionate about working together to reinvent mobility, making it smarter and more sustainable. Day after day, we are building an agile, inclusive and responsible culture, where a diverse group of people are offered opportunities to learn, grow and advance in their careers, with options across functions and geographic locations. Are you ready to join a truly international community of great people on a challenging journey with a tangible impact and purpose?

  


**Equal opportunity statement:**  

Alstom is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating an inclusive working environment where all our employees are encouraged to reach their full potential, and individual differences are valued and respected. All qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by local law.

title: Science Teacher
description:
**High School Science Teacher**

**Position Overview**

Mount Saint Dominic Academy, an all-girls Catholic independent school, is seeking an experienced and passionate High School Science Teacher. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of teaching Advanced Placement (AP) Biology and AP Environmental Science. In addition, the teacher will be responsible for leading other science electives, such as Human Anatomy and Physiology, and Forensic Science. This role provides a unique opportunity to educate and inspire young women in a supportive and challenging academic environment.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Teach AP Biology and AP Environmental Science, preparing students for AP examinations and fostering a deep understanding of complex scientific concepts.
* Develop and instruct engaging electives in Human Anatomy and Physiology, and Forensic Science, tailored to students' interests and educational needs.
* Cultivate a positive and inclusive classroom environment that encourages active participation, intellectual curiosity, and respect for all students.
* Create, administer, and evaluate assessments to monitor and support student progress and understanding.
* Provide academic support and mentorship, helping students reach their full potential both inside and outside the classroom.
* Participate in ongoing professional development opportunities to stay current with best practices in science education and pedagogical strategies.
* Work closely with fellow faculty, administration, and parents to support student success and uphold the mission and values of the Academy.

**Qualifications**

* Bachelor's degree in Science, Biology, Environmental Science, or a related field; a Master's degree is preferred.
* Valid state teaching certification in Secondary Science or eligibility to obtain certification.
* Proven experience teaching AP Biology and AP Environmental Science; experience in teaching electives such as Human Anatomy and Physiology, and Forensic Science is highly desirable.

Please send resumes to: mainoffice@msdacademy.org

title: Vice President, Traditional Media Planning (Entertainment Client)
description:
**Company Description**  

About Spark Foundry:


Spark Foundry is a global media agency that exists to bring HEAT – Higher Engagement, Affinity, and Transactions – to brands. By combining flawless media fundamentals with aggressive innovation, Spark inspires consumers to pay more attention, to care more about our clients’ brands, and to buy more products and services from them.


Balancing the nimble spirit of a startup with the powerhouse soul of Publicis Media, Spark Foundry delivers the best of both worlds to a client roster that spans some of the world’s best and most beloved brands and companies. We combine boutique-caliber insights and service with the buying clout and first-look access of a global leader, bringing the heat to challenger brands that want to act like giants, and to giant brands that want to act like challengers.


With a bottom-up culture that celebrates diversity and aims for all voices to be heard, Spark has become a magnet for the industry’s best talent, with one of the best retention rates in the industry. And by applying a whole-person approach to professional and personal development, Spark develops a workforce that is well prepared for today’s challenges, and also poised to create meaningful careers in the years to come.


Because we know that heat arises the intersection of complementary forces, our professionals come from myriad disciplines and backgrounds: data, analytics, and insights, content and creative production, communications and strategy, finance and marketing, and sociology, psychology, and other liberal arts disciplines.

 **Job Description**  

Overview:  

The Vice President, Planning oversees a team of professionals in the conception and delivery of innovative, well-targeted, business-building marketing solutions across all media. This involves the creation, execution and maintenance of marketing plans, unearthing insights to inform the development of plans, and flawless execution on all fronts.

  

Role Objectives:


Innovation and Growth

* Measurably expands utilization of digital, analytics and communication strategy creation capabilities in assigned key account or suite of accounts year-over-year
* Continuously surveys pulse of client and client-industry needs to prompt and feed innovative ideas/solutions to internal digital, analytics and human experience creation leads
* Builds and hones deep and trusting relationships with decision-makers/influencers at assigned clients to foster new business opportunities
* Provides constructive and executable feedback regarding company product to SMEs to drive overall improvements in product quality and identify/influence new product/capability development
* Proactively ideates with team and colleagues to produce novel (award-worthy) solutions for clients
* May participate in new business pitches as required

  

Talent Capability/Acquisition and Development

* Drives continual evolution of high-performance culture through active networking with prospective candidates, performance management, and employee engagement
* Actively participates in critical assessment of assigned talent at all levels and ensures developmental plans and feedback in place to support motivation, retention of high-performance team members, and manage succession
* Seeks opportunities to stay up-to-date on technology, tools, techniques, communication software, social media and self-awareness

  

Global Orientation and Change Management

* Champions cultural attributes and continuously strives for diversity and inclusivity of talent to foster healthy culture and broad perspectives in our human experience deliverables for clients
* Continuously assesses and challenges company positioning and strategy in global marketplace and relevance to clients to maintain competitive edge
* Effectively manages cross-functional initiatives and relationships and champions SME integration into team
* May serve as team lead/member on all-agency initiatives

  

Business Acumen and Fiscal Responsibility

* Forecasts, monitors, and maintains health of financial portfolio of assigned clients; attains established revenue growth and OI
* Builds/develops financial acumen of team
* Models and coaches team how to effectively manage and influence clients to solutions that best meet client’s business need and are aligned with our capabilities to effectively and efficiently deliver

 **Qualifications*** 10+ years of Digital Media experience for VP level with progressive levels of responsibility and business acumen in marketing and communications, team management and P&L management
* Must have Online and Offline media experience, including TV, Display, Search, Social, and Mobile
* Demonstrated ability to establish high levels of trust and credibility internally and externally, able to influence others to action
* Excellent written, verbal and presentation skills – effectively presents formal POVs internally and externally
* Strong leadership skills and general management orientation
* Critical assessor of talent – builds and motivates high-performing teams
* Demonstrated critical thinking skill and strong problem-solving skills – navigates effectively through difficult issues, builds required consensus to drive business needs and results
* High results-orientation, able to effectively juggle and prioritize many competing demands – high tolerance to effectively manage change
* Able to establish and manage to P&L statement
* Team oriented – approachable and viewed as coach and mentor to others

 **Additional Information**  

This is a hybrid role, requiring three days in-office each week. If you are contacted for an interview, your recruiter will discuss specifics with you, inclusive of any necessary reasonable accommodations.


If you require accommodation or assistance with the application or onboarding process specifically, please contact USMSTACompliance@publicis.com.


All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.


Compensation Range: $143,000-$225,000 annually. This is the pay range the Company believes it will pay for this position at the time of this posting. Consistent with applicable law, compensation will be determined based on the skills, qualifications, and experience of the applicant along with the requirements of the position, and the Company reserves the right to modify this pay range at any time. For this role, the Company will offer medical coverage, dental, vision, disability, 401k, and paid time off. The Company anticipates the application deadline for this job posting will be 07/29/2024.

title: Middle School Principal
company: The NYC Charter High School AECI
description:
**Middle School Principal(s)**

**School:** AECI 1 Middle School & AECI 2 Middle

**School Location:** TBD (Bronx District 7 & 9 Region)Opening: September 2025

**Application Deadline:** December 31, 2024

**Opening:** September 2025

**Application Deadline**: December 31, 2024

***About AECI Middle School’s***

AECI 1 & AECI 2 Middle School are brand-new educational institutions opening in September 2025, dedicated to fostering a community of academic excellence, innovation, and personal growth. Our mission is to provide a supportive and challenging learning environment that prepares students to explore the skills, knowledge, and practical experiences leading to college and a career focused in the architecture, engineering and construction industries.

The AECI Charter Schools Network is looking for a dynamic, committed Principal to lead either AECI 1 Middle School or AECI 2 Middle School; to inspire our students and support our school community to advanced levels of success. The AECI Network Middle School Principal is expected to fulfill the following:

**Responsibilities:**

* **Leadership and Vision**: Develop and implement a clear vision and strategic plan for the school's growth and success. Foster a positive, inclusive, and collaborative school culture aligned with AECI’s mission and goals
* **Academic Excellence**: Oversee curriculum development and ensure the implementation of rigorous and engaging instructional practices. Monitor student progress and achievement, ensuring all students meet and exceed academic standards
* **Staff Development**: Recruit, mentor, and evaluate a diverse and talented faculty. Provide ongoing professional development opportunities and support to enhance teaching effectiveness and student outcomes
* **Community Engagement**: Build strong relationships with students, parents, staff, and the wider community. Promote active parental involvement and foster community partnerships that support the school’s mission
* **Operational Management**: Manage the school's daily operations, including budgeting, scheduling, and resource allocation. Ensure compliance with all local, state, and federal regulations and policies
* **Student Support**: Advocate for the academic, social, and emotional well-being of all students. Implement programs and services that address the diverse needs of the student population, promoting a safe and inclusive school environment

**Qualifications:**

* **Educational Background**: Master’s degree in Educational Leadership, Administration, or a related field
* **Certification**: Valid NYS, School Building Leader (SBL) certification
* **Experience**: Minimum of 5 years of teaching experience and 3 years of administrative experience, preferably at the middle school level
* **Leadership Skills**: Demonstrated ability to lead and inspire a school community. Strong organizational, communication, and interpersonal skills
* **Commitment to Diversity**: Experience working in diverse educational settings. Commitment to equity and inclusion in education
* **Visionary**: Ability to develop and articulate a clear vision for a new school. Innovative and forward-thinking approach to education

**What We Offer:**

**Competitive Salary and Benefits**: AECI Network Middle Schools offer a comprehensive compensation package, including health, dental, and retirement benefits

**Professional Growth**: Opportunities for ongoing professional development and career advancement. Participation in a vibrant educational community with access to cutting-edge resources and training

**Supportive Environment**: Work in a collaborative and supportive environment with dedicated educators and staff who share a commitment to excellence and innovation.

**Impactful Work**: Lead the development of a new school and make a lasting impact on the community and the lives of our students. Opportunity to shape the future of education at AECI 1 Middle School

**How to Apply:**

Interested candidates should submit the following documents:

* A cover letter outlining your vision for an AECI Middle School and your leadership philosophy
* A detailed resume/CV
* Copies of relevant certifications

Please send your application materials to: Network CEO: Derick T. Spaulding

**Dspaulding@aecicharterhs.org** 

Please CC your application materials to: Network HR: Hector Rodriguez

**Hrodriguez@aecicharterhs.org**

For more information about AECI 1 Middle School, please visit:

For more information about AECI 2 Middle School, please visit:

**Equal Opportunity Employer:**

AECI Charter Schools Network & AECI Middle Schools are an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We encourage applications from individuals of all backgrounds and experiences.

**We look forward to receiving your application and learning more about how you can contribute to the success of AECI Middle Schools!**

title: IT Support Technician III
description:
Responsible for end user support of computer workstations and associated peripherals. Diagnoses and troubleshoots all organizational software, hardware and mobile devices.  

  

  

  

**Principal Accountabilities:**  

  

1. Manages multiple complex priorities and projects.
  

2. Provides configuration and or installations documenters to guide other technicians.
  

3. Provides timely resolution to all assigned calls and or tasks and escalates calls to the appropriate technical groups.
  

4. Acts as an ambassador of the department dealing with all customers in a professional manner.
  

5. Interacts with all ISS staff members to achieve successful implementation and maintenance of organizational hardware and software.
  

6. Regularly trains team members on technical skills.
  

7. Visits offsite locations and provide service to our customers.
  

8. Ensures Asset Management database is monitored, and discrepancies are remediated
  

9. Works with vendors as necessary to achieve successful implementation and maintenance of hospital hardware and software.
  

10. Performs other related duties as assigned.


  
Required:
  

1. Associates degree, technical degree in Information Technology or related field.
  

2. 5+ years of experience in Desktop Support, System Implementation or relevant area.
  

3. Any of the following Certifications highly preferred: - Certified Azure Fundamentals Microsoft 365 - Certified Fundamentals MCITP: Enterprise Desktop Support Technician 7 - MCITP: Enterprise Desktop Administrator 7 or - MCP, MCDST - MCSA: Administering Windows Server


4. Ability to lift 50+ lbs
  

  

Preferred:Familiarity with networking systems and protocols.


  
ABOUT US


At Atlantic Health System, our promise to our communities is; Anyone who enters one of our facilities, will receive the highest quality care delivered at the right time, at the right place, and at the right cost. This commitment is also echoed in the respect, development and opportunities we give to our more than 20,000 team members. Headquartered in Morristown, New Jersey, we are one of the leading non-profit health care systems in the nation. Our facilities and sites of care include:


* Morristown Medical Center, Morristown, NJ
* Overlook Medical Center, Summit, NJ
* Newton Medical Center, Newton, NJ
* Chilton Medical Center, Pompton Plains, NJ
* Hackettstown Medical Center, Hackettstown, NJ
* Goryeb Children's Hospital, Morristown, NJ
* CentraState Healthcare System, Freehold, NJ
* Atlantic Home Care and Hospice
* Atlantic Mobile Health
* Atlantic Rehabilitation

We also have more than 900 community-based healthcare providers affiliated through Atlantic Medical Group. Atlantic Accountable Care Organization is one of the largest ACOs in the nation, and we are a member of AllSpire Health Partners.


We have received awards and recognition for the services we have provided to our patients, team members and communities. Below are just a few of our accolades:


* 100 Best Companies to Work For ® and FORTUNE® magazine for 15 years

* One of the 20 Best Workplaces in Health Care: Great Place to Work® and FORTUNE® magazine
* Official Health Care Partner of the New York Jets
* NJ Sustainable Business

title: Manager 1 - Procurement (contract)
description:
**Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies**

**Title:** Manager - Transportation Procurement

**Location: New Brunswick, NJ**

**Duration: 4 months**

**Pay Rate: $49.05**

**Benefits on offer for this contract position:** Health Insurance, Life insurance, 401K and Voluntary Benefits

*Please note that this is a contract role providing services to the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies through external staffing partners of Kelly OCG. If you are selected for this role, you will be employed by a contract staffing supplier and will not be a member of the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies.*

 **Summary:**

Accountable for the day-to-day operation of the transportation procurement function. Responsible for the development, implementation, and ongoing management of operations plans for the department that are in line with and support overall business objectives.

 **Responsibilities:**

* Manages the day-to-day operational, functional, and personnel activities of the transportation procurement department.
* Proposes and provides input to transportation purchasing policies, procedures, and performance standards.
* Conducts department internal audits and implements remedies to achieve conformance with transportation procurement policies, procedures, and quality specifications.
* Manages budget and manpower acquisition for transportation procurement and ensures expenses stay within budget parameters by implementing cost controls.
* Provides input to transportation procurement objectives and communicates objectives to staff. Oversees department's performance against objectives.
* Summarizes issues and actions taken on escalated problems for management and executes resolutions.
* Reviews reports on key market trends and pricing in transportation procurement and provides results to management.
* Approves supplier selection and handles negotiation of contracts for transportation procurement initiatives.
* Establishes and maintains effective communication with transportation vendors to ensure service and quality standards are met.
* Collaborates with other departments to ensure transportation procurement needs are met.
* Continuously improves transportation procurement processes and strategies to optimize efficiency and reduce costs.
* Keeps updated with industry best practices and emerging trends in transportation procurement.
* Manages relationships with transportation providers and evaluates their performance based on agreed criteria.
* Manages transportation procurement budget and seeks opportunities for cost savings and efficiencies.
* Coordinates with legal and compliance teams to ensure adherence to regulations in transportation procurement.
* Provides support and guidance to staff in transportation procurement activities and professional development.

 **Qualifications:**

Education Required: University/Bachelor's degree or Equivalent


Generally Requires 8-10 Years Work Experience

title: Expansion Operator
description:
**Job Summary**

The Expansion Operator will expand, cut, inspect, bag, and tag tubing.  



**Job Responsibilities**

* Spooling input onto heat shrink spools
* Some coiling of input
* Clamping, taping, cutting, inspecting, bagging, tagging, straighten tubing; labeling and preparing orders for shipping
* Packing heat shrink dies in oven; setting up heat shrink equipment to produce proper specs on tubing for order
* Keep accurate records-paperwork
* Keep a clean, safe workplace
* Observe all safety rules and regulations
* Occasional utility work
The preparation of dual shrink tubing  
* 

**Qualifications**

* The employee must have the ability to perform inspection functions such as visual inspection to detect cosmetic defects and color differentiation of products
* Solvents: Naphtha, acetone, alcohol in area; safety equipment and rules must be used.
* Standing/ Within a 30 foot by 36” area. Very little time to sit down.
* Lifting: Up to 40 pounds periodically to a height of 36"
* Walking: Constant, some stationary standing.
* Writing: Legible writing is a must using pens, to constantly fill in worksheet data.
* Safety Equipment: Heat gloves, safety glasses, and protective gear when needed.
* Cleaning: Using brooms, mops, rags all-purpose cleaners to keep entire area clean as required.
* A thorough knowledge of standard and good sense practices is a must. Ability to carry out oral and written instructions along with the ability to adapt to different situations.
* Any combination of experience that enables a person to make sound judgments and decisions.
* Basic mathematics knowledge is helpful.
* Attendance and punctuality are essential functions of this position. Any unscheduled absence or tardy will have a negative impact on our ability to meet our production objectives.

  

  

  
Zeus Industrial Products, headquartered in Orangeburg, South Carolina, is the world’s leading polymer extrusion manufacturer and material science innovator. More than 50 years of experience in medical, aerospace, energy, automotive, fiber optics, and more allows us to set the bar high.  

  

Zeus is a great place to work. Expectations are high; our work is meticulous and very precise. Zeus offers an opportunity to join a very successful, family-oriented team. Our products are cutting-edge, our process is unique, and our quality and customer focus are second-to-none. We are a leader in our field and have great relationships with our customers and team members. Many of our team members are the best at what they do in the world. Our customers are leaders in their fields. Our products help save lives.  

  

Continuous Improvement is a way of life at Zeus. Successful candidates will have a desire and ability to take our manufacturing process to the next level. Expectations are high; our work is meticulous and very precise. You must possess the ability to work independently; and the desire to learn a variety of skills. The ability to communicate clearly is imperative, as is the ability to manipulate data using various software packages.  

  

At Zeus, what we do matters, and we pride ourselves in “Turning polymers into possibilities.” Expectations are high; our products are cutting-edge, our process is unique, and our quality and customer focus are second-to-none.  

  

Our employees and our customers are at the center of everything we do. Those relationships have been built on a foundation that is supported by our Mission and Vision:  

  

Our Mission: Provide Solutions – Enable Innovation – Enhance Lives  

  

Our Vision: Working Together – Doing It Better  

  

Zeus is an exciting, innovative company that offers competitive pay and a great benefits package. As we continue to push the boundaries of polymer science, we’re constantly in need of new ideas, new expertise, and new team members. Are you ready to join us?

title: Registered Nurse, PD Parent Education OMC
description:
Responsible for working with other healthcare professionals to help treat patients with various injuries, illnesses or disabilities. Monitors patients, administers medications, keeps records, consults with healthcare providers, educates patients and more.


***Essential Job Functions:***

*The selected candidate will provide Lactation Consultation services to new moms and infants postpartum in the hospital and assist with outpatient consults.*

*The candidate will also facilitate breastfeeding support group and teach breastfeeding classes prenatally.* 

*Candidate will have the ability to utilize the nursing process to assess, diagnose, plan, implement and evaluate the plan of care for patients served.*

*Through the model of Shared Governance, collaborate with all members of the health care team with a focus on promoting evidenced based care within a healing culture for the patient population served and their families.*

*Candidate will demonstrate and embrace the PRIDE core values (Purpose, Respect, Innovation, Diversity & Inclusion and Extraordinary Caring ) in every aspect of their job.*

*Candidate must have excellent communication and computer skills.*  

  

  

**Principal Accountabilities:**  

  

1. Maintains accurate, complete health care records and reports.
  

2. Monitors, reports, and records symptoms or changes in patient conditions.
  

3. Assesses, implements, plans, or evaluates patient nursing care plans by working with healthcare team members.
  

4. Records medical information.
  

5. Performs other related duties as assigned.


  
Required:
  

1. Bachelor degree in Nursing or related field or enrolled in a BSN program.
  

2. 2-3+ years of experience in Nursing or relevant area.
  

3. Current state licensure as a Registered Nurse and BLS certification required.
  

4. IBCLC certification and/or LCCE.
  

  

Preferred:
  

1. Masters degree in Nursing or related field.


2. Previous experience with teaching childbirth classes and prenatal education.


3. Previous experience with lactation consulting.


  
ABOUT US


At Atlantic Health System, our promise to our communities is; Anyone who enters one of our facilities, will receive the highest quality care delivered at the right time, at the right place, and at the right cost. This commitment is also echoed in the respect, development and opportunities we give to our more than 20,000 team members. Headquartered in Morristown, New Jersey, we are one of the leading non-profit health care systems in the nation. Our facilities and sites of care include:


* Morristown Medical Center, Morristown, NJ
* Overlook Medical Center, Summit, NJ
* Newton Medical Center, Newton, NJ
* Chilton Medical Center, Pompton Plains, NJ
* Hackettstown Medical Center, Hackettstown, NJ
* Goryeb Children's Hospital, Morristown, NJ
* CentraState Healthcare System, Freehold, NJ
* Atlantic Home Care and Hospice
* Atlantic Mobile Health
* Atlantic Rehabilitation

We also have more than 900 community-based healthcare providers affiliated through Atlantic Medical Group. Atlantic Accountable Care Organization is one of the largest ACOs in the nation, and we are a member of AllSpire Health Partners.


We have received awards and recognition for the services we have provided to our patients, team members and communities. Below are just a few of our accolades:


* 100 Best Companies to Work For ® and FORTUNE® magazine for 15 years
* Best Places to Work in Healthcare - Modern Healthcare
* 150 Top Places to work in Healthcare - Becker's Healthcare
* 100 Accountable Care Organizations to Know - Becker's Hospital Review
* Best Employers for Workers over 50 - AARP
* Gold-Level "Well Workplace": Wellness Council of America (WELCOA)
* One of the 100 Best Workplaces for “Millennials” Great Place to Work® and FORTUNE® magazine
* One of the 20 Best Workplaces in Health Care: Great Place to Work® and FORTUNE® magazine
* Official Health Care Partner of the New York Jets
* NJ Sustainable Business

Named one of America's 50 Best Hospitals by Healthgrades, a World’s Best Hospital by Newsweek and recognized as a Best Regional Hospital in the NY Metro area by U.S. News & World Report.
  

  

Our Atlantic Neuroscience Institute is the region’s leader in neuroscience care. A hub for the New Jersey Stroke Network, we offer a broad range of advanced neurological, neurosurgical and neurodiagnostic services. We are also certified as a Level IV Epilepsy Center and home to the Gerald J. Glasser Brain Tumor Center, where more brain tumor surgeries are performed than anywhere else in New Jersey. Our CyberKnife® program is the largest and most experienced in the state. We also have a satellite emergency department in Union, NJ, which treats about 40,000 emergency cases each year.
  

  

Committed to providing exceptional care, Overlook Medical Center has achieved the prestigious Magnet® recognition. This designation from the American Nurses Credentialing Center is the highest national honor for nursing excellence. What’s more, Overlook Medical Center has advanced certification from The Joint Commission for perinatal care and is designated an Advanced Comprehensive Stroke Center. Additional Joint Commission-certified services include behavioral health care, spine surgery, wound care, and primary care medical home (PCMH).

title: App Systems Analyst I
description:
**Application Systems Analyst I Overview**

The Application Systems Analyst I is a full-time position with Atlantic Health System’s (AHS) Information Technology Division. The position is responsible for primary support of the Research suite of applications. The work is accomplished in a team environment and requires excellent problem-solving and communication skills and a high level of professionalism.


**Responsibilities:**

An Application Systems Analyst I responsibilities includes:


* Configure and customize Electronic Medical Records (EMR) systems to support clinical workflows, ensuring the system meets the specific needs of healthcare providers and research protocols.
* Provide technical support and troubleshooting for EMR systems and ancillary research applications, address user issues, and optimize system functionality to enhance user experience and data accuracy.
* Collect and analyze clinical and demographic clinical trial details and utilize advanced data analysis techniques to identify eligible candidates for clinical trials, ensuring adherence to trial eligibility criteria and guidelines.
* Performs In-depth analysis of workflows, system details, and technical issues associated with the applications supported
* Analyze new functionality and recommend how it should be used to prioritize and implement requested changes to the system.
* Interfaces with key IT, clinical, business, and operations staff to assist in developing efficient workflows.
* Participates in testing system enhancements and performs rigorous testing to deliver high-quality end-user solutions
* Designs and delivers solution innovation to improve services or to lower costs, operating under deadlines and challenging workloads
* Solves problems and develops solutions to tasks or projects that may be unique, using judgment and initiative with the support of senior team analyst
* Assist in ancillary vendor outreach and relationship management to deliver functional and compliant research applications and online portals.
* Seeks assistance from expert resources when needed and escalates appropriately
* Responsible for being available to work on an on-call basis for system upgrades, downtimes, go-lives, and departmental needs

  
**Qualifications:**

Education:


* Bachelor's degree in Healthcare Administration, Public Health, Mathematics, Healthcare Informatics or Computer Science or equivalent experience

Requirements:


* Demonstrated ability to gather information from multiple sources and analyze applicability and appropriateness, and develop an efficient workflow
* Excellent interpersonal, communication, leadership and change management skills to establish and maintain positive and productive working relationships

Preferred


* Demonstrated knowledge of clinical and/or practices and principles
* Work experience within information technology or applicable area of healthcare
* Experience with application build and configuration

title: Physical Therapy Aide
description:
Job Title: Physical Therapy Aide **Job Type: Part-time** **Shift: M,W,R,F 2pm-8pm**  

Location: Piscataway, NJ  

Company: SportsCare Physical Therapy  

About Us:
SportsCare Physical Therapy is a leading provider of physical therapy and rehabilitation services, committed to helping individuals achieve their health and fitness goals. We are looking for a motivated and compassionate Physical Therapy Aide to join our team and support our mission of providing exceptional patient care.
Job Description:
As a Physical Therapy Aide at SportsCare Physical Therapy, you will play a crucial role in supporting our clinical team and ensuring that our patients receive the highest quality of care. You will work directly with physical therapists, physical therapist assistants, and patients, assisting in the delivery of treatment and promoting a positive and supportive clinic environment.
Responsibilities:* Assist with Patient Care: Provide direct support to patients during their therapy sessions, following the guidance of the physical therapist or physical therapist assistant. This may involve assisting with exercises, equipment setup, and ensuring patient safety.
* Prepare Treatment Areas: Set up treatment areas and equipment, ensuring they are clean, organized, and ready for patient use.
* Patient Education: Assist in patient education by explaining exercises, proper form, and treatment goals as directed by the clinical team.
* Maintain Cleanliness: Keep treatment areas, exercise equipment, and therapy rooms clean and sanitized to maintain a safe and hygienic environment.
* Laundry and Supplies: Assist with laundry duties, such as washing and folding linens, towels, and other materials. Monitor and restock supplies as needed.
* Patient Records: Maintain accurate and confidential patient records, including tracking and documenting patient progress and adherence to exercise programs.
* Equipment Maintenance: Ensure that therapy equipment is properly maintained and report any equipment issues to the appropriate staff.
* Communication: Effectively communicate with patients, physical therapists, and other team members to facilitate a smooth patient experience.
  

Qualifications:* High school diploma or equivalent.
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with a compassionate and patient-focused attitude.
* Ability to follow instructions and work as part of a team.
* Basic knowledge of anatomy, physiology, and medical terminology is beneficial.
* Physical stamina and the ability to lift and move equipment and assist patients as required.
* Commitment to patient privacy and confidentiality.

Benefits:* Competitive compensation.
* Opportunities for professional growth and advancement in the healthcare field.
* Collaborative and supportive team environment.
* The chance to make a meaningful impact on patients' rehabilitation journeys.
  

If you are a compassionate and motivated individual interested in healthcare and physical therapy, we encourage you to apply for the position of Physical Therapy Aide at SportsCare Physical Therapy. Join our team and help us create a positive and supportive environment for our patients as they work towards their health and fitness goals. *Note: We are an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.*

title: Landscape Lighting Designer/Salesperson
description:

title: Inventory Supervisor
description:
**Hours: 8am - 5pm availability daily. Weekend availability is required.**


Primary responsibility of Operations Supervisor is to supervise the day-to-day operations and administrative responsibilities of the Asurion forward stocking locations for various in-home client programs. This person serves as an integral part of the Supply Chain Management support team in providing support and ensuring smooth and effective operations and will provide a variety of professional, fiscal, administrative, and/or clerical services to department and management.
  

  

As a Supervisor within Asurion you will promote teamwork, collaboration, quality/production standards, professionalism and integrity to ensure that departmental results are delivered in accordance with Asurion Core Values.

  

As a Forward Stocking Location Supervisor, here’s what you can expect to:

* Plan and implement warehouse operations as well as administrative support to meet quality and productivity metrics as well as overall business needs.
* Supervise teams to ensure product arrival dispositions according to process, inventory and shipping protocols are followed.
* Troubleshoot issues related to office management, including telephony, computers, printers, and facilities.
* Maintain inventory accuracy by researching and performing follow-ups when discrepancies arise.
* Update department work instructions and improve process flow.
* Perform miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned by manager.
* Collaborate pro-actively and successfully across departmental boundaries.
* Monitor and update applicable management software programs as needed
* Facilitate and supervise company vehicle parking, maintenance and overall compliance
* On a daily basis operate in compliance with Federal, State and Local authorities

  

Here’s what you’ll bring to the team:

  

Skills/knowledge:

* Knowledge of supply chain integration, logistics network designs and warehouse best practices.
* Proficient in Microsoft (Word, Excel and PowerPoint).
* Ability to navigate and root cause opportunities to seek resolution.
* Strong ability to handle ambiguity and adapts readily and easily to changes.
* Strong verbal and written communication, presentation and team facilitations skills.
* Must be able to multi-task in a fast-paced environment.
* Ability to be self-managed and set priorities


Experience/education:

* 3 years of relevant experience.
* Supervisory/Team Leadership experience including inventory Management
* Bachelor's degree preferred

  

Physical demands: Bending, sitting, lifting, and standing based on the need of the business. Standing and/or sitting for extended and long periods of time, up to 100% of shift or over time.

 **We take care of you (benefits/perks):**

* Competitive pay and inclusive benefits (health, dental, and vision)
* Performance-based incentives
* Retirement savings plan
* Paid time off
* Employee Assistance Program
* Life insurance
* Continuing education support
* Ongoing training to grow your skills
* Opportunities for advancement

**About Asurion**


As the world’s leading tech care company, Asurion eliminates the fears and frustrations associated with technology, to ensure our 300 million customers get the most out of their devices, appliances and connections. We provide insurance, repair, replacement, installation and 24/7 support for everything from cellphones to laptops and household appliances. Our experts are available online, on the phone, at one of our more than 700 stores, or can even come to you.

title: Concierge Registered Nurse ~ 5 Years of Experience Required
description:
**About Us**

MD² Madison Avenue is an exclusive concierge primary care practice located on the upper eastside of Manhattan. The practice is led by two of the most renowned internists in New York and together with their three spectacular medical staff members, deliver an exquisite level of care to 50 select families in a private and beautifully appointed office setting. By dedicating their practice to such a small number of families, only MD² physicians can change the experience of healthcare for their discerning patients.

The heritage and pedigree of MD² is unparalleled. As the founder of concierge medicine in 1996, MD² remains the most prestigious provider of personalized medicine in the country, spanning the nation with 26 meticulously curated medical practices and counting. This is medicine in the ideal for those who expect excellence in all aspects of their lives.

**About You**

MD² Madison Avenue is hiring a seasoned **Registered Nurse**, with outstanding medical skills as well as exceptional interpersonal skills. This full-time position provides a unique nursing experience, where caring for your patients is a joy and a gift and care is no longer dictated by minutes on the clock. The pace is relaxed and work-life balance is restored. The person we are looking for has a deep appreciation for the art of hospitality and customer service and thrives in a professional and personalized environment. This is a rare opportunity to join an elite team that is delivering primary care at a level far exceeding that of a tradition hospital or contract nursing assignment. If you are always seeking to deliver exceptional medical experiences to your patients, this is the ideal position for you.

**A Day in the Life**

In this position you will work with two other medical staff members to perform various primary care tasks in addition to clinic administrative duties, with the goal of delivering unparalleled experiences to your patients, at each and every touchpoint. We believe that a truly great experience (unknown in healthcare) is made up of every considered detail, which is why MD² remains best-in-class. Some of your responsibilities would include:

· Greet patients at the door and assist them throughout their appointment.

· Ensure the highest level of empathy, kindness and understanding in delivering patient care.

· Contribute to the professional atmosphere of the office, from your attire to your communications.

· Maintain the strictest level of patient confidentiality.

· Work in unison with your colleagues and physicians to deliver the highest level of operational and clinical standards.

· Ensure effective, ongoing communication between practice physicians and staff.

· Develop relationships with key specialists in order to facilitate patient care.

**Job Requirements:**

· Must be a seasoned nursing professional; 5+ years of primary practice / clinic experience is desired.

· Appreciation of the unique nature of our practice model and related demands.

· Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

· Strong interpersonal skills and highly developed ability to actively listen to others.

· Ability to draw blood with ease.

· Ability to perform or become proficient with spirometry, EKG, audiogram and stress tests.

· Ability and willingness to comply with company and industry operational standards and requirements.

· Working knowledge of Microsoft Office suite.

· Aptitude for operation and troubleshooting of computer software programs.

· Ability to work as an effective member of a small, tight-knit team.

· Demonstrated integrity, professional maturity and leadership skills.

· Valid drivers license and ability to make house/office calls.

**For Your Hard Work**

· Competitive salary

· Employer paid certifications and training

· Employer paid health benefits

· 401K contributions upon start date

· Paid Parking/Transportation

· Paid Time Off

MD² is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, disability or veteran status, among other factors.

To apply to this position please reply with a copy of your resume.
